LanguageData.WVC_RB_Gene_GolemGestator: {0}'s mechanoid has finished the gestation process.
LanguageData.WVC_RB_Gene_Summoner: The package is already on its way!
LanguageData.WVC_PawnIsAndroidCheck: User and target must be humans and genetically compatible.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_WrongDevelopmentalStage: The target has an inappropriate developmental stage.
LanguageData.WVC_AbilityValidation_ReimplantationChec: Reimplantation in progress. Wait for the process to finish before starting another one.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_General_DisabledIdeo: {PAWN_nameDef}'s ideology prevents {PAWN_objective} from using this ability.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_MessageWrongRottingStage: The target has an inappropriate rotting stage.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GestatedDryadDescription: <color=#f5ffa2>Being gestated</color> by the genetic dryad queen, dryads behave differently from their tree-relatives. They exist in a symbiotic relationship directly with the genetic queen, who in turn gestates new dryads and has a psychic bond with them.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_AdministerXenogermWarningDesc: Depending on the type of serum, its use may put {PAWN_nameDef} in a coma as the xenogerm integrates itself. On average, this lasts for {COMADURATION}.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SuremRetuneJob_Desc: You can change the xenotype that the serum is tuned to.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SuremRetuneJob_ChangeDesc: You have chosen the {0} xenotype. Are you sure of your choice?
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SerumCustomMode_Desc: Allows you to switch between standard and custom mode. Custom xenotypes are always randomized.
LanguageData.WVC_ImplantXenogermSerumDesc: Administer the serum for the selected pawn.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneGiverImplanted_Desc: {0} received the "{1}" gene, due to this {0}'s genes will be regrowing.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_GeneticInstabilityDesc: Pawn will automatically try to use the stabilizer when there are less than 3 days left until the next instabilization.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_GeneticThrallDesc: Pawn will automatically try to bite resurgents or use genetic stabilizer serum when there are less than 3 days left until the next instabilization.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_LetterTextThrallIImplanted: {CASTER_nameDef} has implanted a xenogerm into {TARGET_nameDef}, passing choosed genes onto {TARGET_objective}.\n\n{TARGET_nameDef} became a genetic thrall, thralls have their own strengths and weaknesses, but the main drawback of thralls is that in order to survive they need to regularly delay instabilization by absorbing the resurgent cells of living resurgent pawns.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_LetterDescThrallTransformedIntoG: Due to instabilization, {0_nameDef}'s archites got out of control. {0_possessive} body was irreversibly changed, and {0_possessive} consciousness lost any clarity. Now {0_nameDef} is an eternally hungry, brainless monster.
LanguageData.WVC_ForceXenogermImplantationDesc: Force this person to implant their genes into another individual using a special injector organ. If this person's genes are currently regrowing, they will die in the process.\n\nWhen implanted, the new genes will overwrite the target genes according to the type of the implanter gene.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ReimplantResurrectionRecruiting_: {PAWN_nameDef} belongs to {1} faction, and even if resurrected, it will not join your settlement.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_NewBack_GeneIsNotActive_WrongFac: Faceplate removed by augmentation or loss of eye
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_NewBack_GeneIsFurskin_CanBeDisab: Graphics can be disabled in the settings.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_NewBack_GeneIsRandom: This gene will be replaced by another gene.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_NewBack_GeneIsShuffle: This gene has a 20% chance to be replaced by another gene.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_NewBack_GeneIsAngelicStability: Removing this gene is guaranteed to kill the carrier.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_NewBack_GeneIsGeneticStability: Removing this gene causes temporary damage to the host's immune system.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_NewBack_GeneIsGeneticInStability: Removing this gene will temporarily speed up gene regrowing.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SubXeno_OverrideExistingGenes_De: Does this sub-xenotype overwrite existing genes.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SubXeno_IgnoreExistingGenes_Desc: Does this sub-xenotype add its own genes to the existing ones.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SubXeno_RemovedGenes_Desc: These genes will be removed from the gene set if present.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SubXeno_RandomGenes_Desc: Some of these genes can be added to a gene set.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SubXeno_SubXenotypes_CanEvolveOn: Can this xenotype evolve into another xenotype if it dies.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SubXeno_SubXenotypes_CanEvolveOv: Can this xenotype evolve into another xenotype over time.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SubXeno_EvolveChance_Desc: The chance with which this xenotype evolves when special conditions are met.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SubXeno_SubXenotypesList_Desc: Xenotypes into which this xenotype can evolve.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneThrallMaker_ButtonDesc: Opens a menu where you can select the type of thrall for the implanter.
LanguageData.WVC_LetterTextGenesImplanted: {TARGET_nameDef} will be in a xenogermination coma for the next {COMADURATION} while {TARGET_possessive} body adjusts to the changes.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Extreme_GeneticInstabilityMessag: Due to genetic instability, {0} lost consciousness.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_RegenerationSleepGizmoTip: Pawn can be put into <color=#6bb6bb>regeneration coma</color> at any time, but it will take an hour to come out of it. When falling into a coma, the pawn receives all the same effects as when falling into it from the <color=#6bb6bb>deathless</color> gene. It will last either until <color=#8a8ae6>full recovery</color>, or end when <color=#8a8ae6>time expires</color>.\n\nYou can also <color=#8a8ae6>extend</color> the pawn's coma. The coma is always <color=#8a8ae6>extended</color> for an additional 6 days.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_RegenerationSleepAddHediffTip: Put the pawn into regeneration coma or extend it for 6 days.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_RegenerationSleepRemoveHediffTip: Reset the coma to an hour.
LanguageData.WVC_LetterTextSecondChance_GeneUndead:
Thanks to the {1} gene, {PAWN_nameDef} returns to the world of the living.
It will take {PAWN_objective} some time to recover, but if {PAWN_pronoun} dies again, it will most likely be permanent.
LanguageData.WVC_LetterTextSecondChance_GeneUndeadSha:
Thanks to the {1} gene, {PAWN_nameDef} returns to the world of the living. However, this caused a side effect. {PAWN_nameDef}'s genes have been changed and {PAWN_possessive} xenotype is now {2}.
It will take {PAWN_objective} some time to recover, but if {PAWN_pronoun} dies again, it will most likely be permanent.
LanguageData.WVC_LetterText_GeneRiseFromTheDead: {TARGET_nameDef} was resurrected, but this left a mark on {TARGET_objective}, now {TARGET_nameDef} is completely different.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_AbilityDisabledNoResurgent: {0_labelShort} does not have enough resurgent cells.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_AbilityGeneIsActive_PawnBaseline: Pawn must not have this ability.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_AbilityGeneIsActive_PawnNotHaveG: Pawn does not have the required genes or it is not active
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_AutoBaseDesc: Determines whether the gene will be triggered automatically.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_MechanitorShouldBeLich: The user must be a mechanitor and have the "Spore mechlink" gene.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneBabyTree_desc: If enabled, the baby will be spawned at the end of the countdown.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_WingsDesc: Allows you to switch between walking and flying.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_DisplayStats_Scarifier_MaxS: Responsible for the maximum possible number of scars that a pawn can receive naturally.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_DisplayStats_Undead_CanResu: Responsible for whether the pawn can be auto-resurrected after death.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_DisplayStats_Undead_AlwaysR: The only way to kill is to destroy the body.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_DisplayStats_Undead_CanRein: Responsible for whether the descendant of the pawn will appear in case of death. The minimum chronological age must be greater than {0} years.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_DisplayStats_Undead_CanShap: Responsible for whether the pawn's genes will change after auto-resurrection. This is influenced by the set of genes and xenotype.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_DustMechlinkDesc: Allows you to toggle the automatic mechs summoning. Mechanoids summoned in this way land in drop pods at a random cell on the map.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_Sporelink_ConnectWithResurg: Affects whether resurgent trees will react to the psionic presence of the gene carrier. Resurgent trees only animate golems if they can find at least one psionic presence.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_EternalHunger_HuntWarning: {0} is going to bite one of the colonists!
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_HemogenicMetabolismDesc: If enabled, the hunger bar is slowly replenished, but hemogen consumption increases.
LanguageData.WVC_FeedDownedBloodeaterForcedDesc: If the bloodeater is unable to eat on its own, you can feed it manually.
LanguageData.WVC_StatsReport_RechargerGeneClass_Desc: Genes with which xenohumans can use this recharger. The following genes are compatible
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_InvisibilityDesc: Allows you to turn invisibility on and off.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GolemBandwidthGizmoTip: A mechanitor can oversee as many <color=#8a8ae6>golems</color> as <color=#8a8ae6>mechanoids</color>, but creating <color=#8a8ae6>new</color> ones requires a <color=#8a8ae6>golembond</color>. Each <color=#8a8ae6>golem</color> consumes a different amount of <color=#8a8ae6>golembond</color>.\n\nGain more golembond with help of <color=#6bb6bb>genes</color>.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneGolemlinkSummonSettings_Desc: Opens a menu where you can configure which golems will be animated by archites. Does not affect summoning.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GolemnoidsGeneralDesc: In general golemnoids are dense clusters of archites animating a pile of “something”, they, like mechanoids, require mechlink and bandwidth for control, in addition to this they require golembond. Golems lose energy much faster than mechs, but very quickly restore the lost charge in shutdown mode.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ChangeGolemCaste_NonChunk_NonGol: Not enough golembond or no available chunks in range.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ChangeGolemCasteDescFull: Give the golem the order to change type. The golem will try to find a free chunk, and then the archites will move from the old body to the new one. In the process, this golem will be converted into a chunk. The new golem will not inherit anything from the old one.\n\nDo you wish to continue?
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ChangeGolemModeDesc: Archites in a golem can be ordered to change their golem type. This requires a free chunk and enough golembond.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GolemCreatedFromRandomChunk_Mess: Archites animated the chunk, the new golem is called {0}.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_GolemlinkGizmoSpawnDesc: Allows you to toggle the automatic creation of new golems. New golems will be created from stone chunks scattered on the map, if there are no chunks, then the golems will be summoned. Golems summoned in this way land in drop pods at a random cell on the map.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_Golemlink_On_Info: Next golems animated or summoned in
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ThrallsBandwidthGizmoGizmoTip:
Thrall master can create an unlimited number of thralls. But each thrall requires a source of resurgent cells for its existence. If the thralls are unable to <color=#95d0fc>cellsfeed</color> for too long, they will begin to die.

The main source of resurgent cells for thralls are resurgent pawns; the more <color=#6bb6bb>resurgent pawns</color>, the more thralls can be kept alive. <color=#6bb6bb>Genetic stabilizers</color> can also be used as an alternative.

Thralls cannot <color=#95d0fc>cellsfeed</color> on pawns with cells level below 20%.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_BroodmindLimitGizmoTip:
The dryad master can partially control an unlimited number of dryads, but dryadbond is required to gestate new ones.

Each dryad, regardless of type, consumes 1 dryadbond. Gain more dryadbond by connecting with <color=#f76d6b>gauranlen trees</color> or with help of <color=#6bb6bb>genes</color>.

The level of connection with <color=#f76d6b>gauranlen trees</color> does not affect the bonus.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_GauranlenConnection_SpawnOn: Allows you to enable or disable the gestation of new dryads.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ChooseDryadCasteModeInitialDesc: Here you can choose a caste for the {0}.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ChangeDreadCasteDescFull: It will take several days for the dryad to change caste, during which time the dryad will be immobilized and defenseless.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_DryadQueenSelectAllDryads_Desc: Select all dryads associated with the queen.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneDryadsSelectDryadQueen_Desc: Select dryad queen to whom this dryad belongs.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_Chimera_GizmoTip:
A chimera can <color=#aad8a2>collect</color> an unlimited number of genes. <color=#aad8a2>Collecting</color> methods depend on <color=#6bb6bb>abilities</color>.

<color=#aad8a2>Collected genes</color> can be implanted or removed at any time, but this will cause <color=#6bb6bb>genes</color> to <color=#6bb6bb>regrowing</color>. Genes are always <color=#6bb6bb>implanted</color> as <color=#6bb6bb>xenogenes</color>. Please note that a chimera cannot <color=#aad8a2>collect</color> its owner's genes.

<color=#b26160>Eaten genes</color> cannot be <color=#aad8a2>collected</color> or <color=#6bb6bb>implanted</color>; these genes are lost for this particular chimera forever. Some genes provide special effects relative to the number of genes <color=#b26160>eaten</color>, but the chimera itself does not have any special bonuses from this.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneGeneticThief_Desc: Here you can select the genes collected by the pawn and implant them.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneGeneticThief_ImplantGeneSet:
The selected genes will be implanted as xenogenes, and the pawn will receive genes regrowing hediff. Genes regrowing may limit the use of certain genes or abilities.

If the chimera gene is xenogene, then it will lose all accumulated genes and become endogene.

If the pawn already has genes regrowing, then all xenogene abilities will have a cooldown after implantation.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneGeneticThief_ClearGeneSet: All xenogenes will be removed, and the chimera gene, if it was a xenogene, will lose all accumulated genes and become endogene.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneGeneticThief_EatSelectedGene: When eaten, genes become inaccessible. They can no longer be re-obtained or implanted, but this can have benefits in some cases.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_CreateChimera_PresetsNameMessage: The preset must have a name.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Dialog_ChimeraPresetsList_Load: The selected preset will replace the selected genes.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_CustomLabeledMechlinkDesc: A neural formation resulting from genetic evolution or modification, similar to what can be obtained by implanting a mechlink.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ChosenLichDesc: Allows you to select the mechanitor to whom the new golem will be assigned.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ChosenWalkerDesc: Allows you to select the type of walker that will spawn the tree.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_AlwaysRandomizeDesc: If enabled, after each spawn, the mechanitor and the next spawn are randomized.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_XenoTreeXenotypeChooseDesc: Allows you to select the xenotype of the future baby.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_XenoTreeXenotypeChooseDisabled_O: First you need to choose a xenotype.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneXenoGestator_Desc: You can choose any xenotype for gestation. Gestation time directly depends on the complexity of the xenotype and the gestation period of the gene carrier.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneXenoGestator_Disabled: Cannot start the gestation process due to the {0}.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneXenoGestator_GestationGenesM: The minimum matched genes must be at least {0}%
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneXenoGestator_GestationGenesS: This person can gestate any xenotype due to its genetic characteristics.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneXenoGestator_GestationWarnin: The gestation process will take time. During this time, the pawn will experience severe hunger and increased fatigue.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneXenoGestator_GestatorIsOnLet: {TARGET_nameDef} has started the gestation process, it will take some time. During this period, {TARGET_nameDef} will receive a number of debuffs.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_Desc: Opens a menu in which you can select any xenotype available in the game. The exceptions are androids and custom xenotypes.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_DisabledGenesRe: This person's genetic material is regrowing.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ShapeshifterDialog_XenotypeGenes: Expected number of xenotype genes. This does not reflect the exact number of genes in the xenotype.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ShapeshifterDialog_TrueFormDesc: This xenotype is one of the natural forms of the shapeshifter. It can be implanted regardless of the owner's genetic condition.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ShapeshifterGizmoTip: Pawn can <color=#8a8ae6>shapeshift</color> (change <color=#6bb6bb>xenotypes</color>) at any time at will. The only restrictions are <color=#6bb6bb>xenogermination coma</color>, <color=#6bb6bb>gene loss shock</color> and <color=#6bb6bb>genes regrowing</color>. Each <color=#8a8ae6>shapeshift</color> imposes <color=#6bb6bb>xenogermination comу</color> and <color=#6bb6bb>genes regrowing</color>; this debuff can be neutralized with the help of some <color=#6bb6bb>genes</color> or <color=#8a8ae6>special serums</color>.\n\nSome <color=#6bb6bb>xenotypes</color> are the so-called <color=#8a8ae6>true form</color>, that is, <color=#8a8ae6>shapeshifting</color> is always possible in them, regardless of the genetic state of the pawn.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_CellularDestroyBodyDesc: Extract archotechnology shard. Extracting the shard will kill the carrier and nullify its xenotype.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneMorpherArchitesLevel_Desc: Order the pawn to find the archite capsule and absorb its contents to increase the maximum form limit.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneMorpherMenu_Desc: Opens a menu where you can view the morpher's saved genesets. Genesets cannot be edited or deleted in this menu.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_MorpherGizmoTip:
The <color=#8a8ae6>morpher</color> changes the pawn's <color=#8a8ae6>geneset</color> from time to time under certain conditions, each <color=#8a8ae6>geneset</color> is called a <color=#8a8ae6>form</color>. The minimum cooldown between form changes is about a day. <color=#8a8ae6>Forms</color> are independent of each other and their <color=#8a8ae6>genesets</color> can be modified without risk of harming another form.

When changing a <color=#8a8ae6>form</color>, the current <color=#8a8ae6>geneset</color> is saved by the <color=#8a8ae6>morpher</color>, and then a random saved one is <color=#8a8ae6>implanted</color> and its information is deleted from the <color=#8a8ae6>morpher</color>. All <color=#6bb6bb>genetic information</color> of the <color=#8a8ae6>implanted form</color> will be the same as it was at the time of its saving. States that involve <color=#6bb6bb>external objects</color> will not be restored and will require repeated manual intervention.

Some <color=#6bb6bb>genes</color> can influence the conditions of the form change, but their effect only affects the form in which they are.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifterStyles_Desc: Opens a menu where you can change the style of the pawn. Including hairstyle and its color, as well as tattoos, both for the face and body.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_NotPreferredXen: Xenotype does not correspond to beliefs.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_CheckBox_Implan: Some xenogene xenotypes are related to endogene xenotypes. If a xenogene xenotype has a double xenotype, then the shapeshifter can implant the genes of that xenotype.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_CheckBox_ClearX: If enabled, xenogens will be removed when implanting an endogene xenotype. For xenogene xenotypes, xenogenes will be removed regardless of this option.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_XenogermComaAft: Does a pawn fall into a xenogermination coma after a shapeshift. This can be changed with a special serum or under certain conditions.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_GenesRegrowAfte: Will pawn genes be regrow after shapeshift. This can be changed with a special serum or under certain conditions.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_ShapeshiftWarni: The pawn's xenotype will be changed to the selected xenotype, and the pawn will lose the genes of the previous xenotype and receive new ones. The shapeshifter gene will not be removed regardless of the selected xenotype.\n\nAfter implantation of new genes, the pawn receives xenogermination coma and genes regrowing.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_ShapeshiftLette: {TARGET_nameDef}'s genes have been significantly changed, {TARGET_possessive} xenotype is now {1}. {TARGET_nameDef} won't be able to use {2} again for a while.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneSpawner_CustomButtonDesc: Allows you to select a product for the spawner gene.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneSpawner_CustomButtonProductC: The product {0} spawned has been changed to {1}.
